author: dyre
msg: DERBY-5979: Part b: 1)  Make properties.dir absolute by prepending ${basedir}. This way the release-targets work even when cwd is not equal to ${basedir} (as could be the case when invoking those target from within an IDE). 2) Change the value of derby.junit.jvm from java to ${java.home}/bin/java. This ensures that junit-ant-tasks work even if invoked from an environment (such as an IDE) where the JAVA_HOME jvm may be different from the first jvm in PATH.
